page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: There are two trunk roads passing through Barlby:the A19 York-Doncaster and the A63 Leeds-Hull.Both roads are extremely busy with traffic going to and from local factories and mines as well as through traffic.Serious hold- ups occur when the Toll Bridge opens. Most of the people who have moved into the new houses have cars so the roads have become even busier. Because there is so much traffic we have a Crossing Patrol outside school to see us safely across the road.The nick-name for the Crossing Patrol is "Lolly-pop man" because of the sign he carries. People in Barlby hope that part of the old Selby to York railway line might be used to make a by-pass to take the traffic round the village.
